result.execSummary:
The defendant Miles John Gloss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Miles John Gloss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Miles John Gloss was found guilty of Burglary-Cargo Portion of Truck/Trailer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Plea to Count 1 was vacated when Court allowed defendant to withdraw his plea on 01/11/2018.
State moved to dismiss Count 1 on 01/11/2018.
Motion granted and Court dismissed Count 1.
Count 1 conviction and sentence vacated on 01/11/2018.

superMiscConds.notes:
$54,704.59 represents restitution plus $5,470.46 restitution surcharge.

Pursuant to Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 07/30/2018, $48,900.30 represents restitution plus $4,890.03 restitution surcharge.  May be amended to include joint and several.

Plus supervision fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents DNA surcharge.
